What is Section 80D and how much health insurance premium can I claim?

Section 80D is a wonderful deduction available to individuals and HUFs (Hindu Undivided Families) in India.

Section 80D allows you to claim a deduction for the premium paid towards a health insurance policy for yourself, your spouse, dependent children, and parents. The deduction is available up to a certain limit, which varies based on the age of the individuals insured.

Here are the deduction limits under Section 80D:

* For self, spouse, and dependent children: ₹25,000 (₹50,000 if you or your spouse is a senior citizen, i.e., 60 years or above)
* For parents: ₹25,000 (₹50,000 if your parents are senior citizens)
* For critical illness policy: Additional ₹25,000 to ₹1 lakh (depending on the age of the individual)

You can claim the actual premium paid or the maximum deduction limit, whichever is lower.

For example, if you've paid a health insurance premium of ₹30,000 for yourself and ₹20,000 for your parents, you can claim a deduction of ₹25,000 (for yourself) + ₹20,000 (for parents) = ₹45,000.

Remember to keep your premium payment receipts and policy documents handy to support your claim.

What is Section 80D and how much health insurance premium can I claim?

Section 80D of the Income Tax Act allows individuals to claim deductions on health insurance premiums paid for themselves, their spouse, children, and parents. The maximum deduction allowed under Section 80D is Rs. 25,000 for individuals below 60 years of age and Rs. 50,000 for senior citizens aged 60 years and above. An additional deduction of up to Rs. 25,000 is allowed for health insurance premiums paid for parents who are senior citizens.
What is Section 80D and how much health insurance premium can I claim?

Section 80D of the Income Tax Act allows individuals to claim deductions for health insurance premiums paid. The maximum deduction allowed under this section is:

- Rs. 25,000 for health insurance premium paid for self, spouse, and dependent children
- An additional Rs. 25,000 for health insurance premium paid for parents (Rs. 50,000 if parents are senior citizens)

So, in total, you can claim up to Rs. 50,000 as a deduction for health insurance premium paid for yourself, spouse, dependent children, and parents (if applicable).
